website_summaries.verdict: Aluminum build and lighting color make this keyboard look and feel high-end. The reasonable price makes it worth consideration.
pros: The aluminum and blue backlight option give it a futuristic appearance
Comes in different finishes with different lighting colors, including an RGB option
cons: The keys hit the aluminum casing while typing, making it louder than normal

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard, but quality issues
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is ok, and feels solid. However, one of the keys lost it's light within only about 2 months, so deducting one star for that. When contacting their customer service I was told that even though it was covered under warranty, I'd have to pay for return shipping. I consider this a bit of a 'hidden cost' because of how quickly it failed, and because of a manufacturer defect I needed to pay more on top of the initial price I paid. Of course maybe I just got really unlucky and got a lemon, but if you also get a defective one prepare to pay return shipping even if it's under warranty but over 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Schmoe

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy, perfect for me to get work done (don't mind the clacking)!
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about the keyboard, from it's sturdy design to keys being true and "clacky". Live the backlight. Cheaper, "normal" keyboards weren't cutting it for me as I run my own business and the cheaper ones were slowing me down. If you don't mind the noise, you may like it, too. I'll take a shirt video clip to illustrate the sound.
customer_reviews.author: David Joel Barabas

customer_reviews.title: Poor LED coverage, hotkeys don't work, loud metallic keys.
customer_reviews.text: LED lights are not consistent. Its very dull in the middle of the keyboard. There is no manual and the manufacture's web site is less than useless. There are some pre-programmed hotkeys like for calculator, email, etc but they don't seem to work reliably. The keys are not to loud but the sound of the keys are reflected off the metal case and amplifies the sound. O-Rings are probably the only hope of getting rid of the metallic clang as the keys bottom out. Space bar is the worst offender. No instructions, but the LED controls are marked (kind of). All in all the keyboard is slightly below average. Loud, metallic keypresses, inconstant LED lighting and hotkeys that don't work.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D Farber

customer_reviews.title: Constantly falling apart
customer_reviews.text: The keys are constantly coming off. I game and type quickly so that might have something to do with it, but any key at any given point will just fly off from movement, pressure, or bumping. I once dropped it about a foot and a half and the whole thing basically shattered. I kid you not I had to hunt down every single key. The lights are nice but mine didn't come with instructions so I had no idea how to change them. There's also no hand rests at the bottom (some have the extra 2 inch piece of plastic at the bottom for the bottom of your palms) so it's not very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Vazhar

customer_reviews.title: Shuts itself off within 5-20 minutes of use
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this keyboard, and I did like it for the brief amount of time that it worked (about 3 days), Now every time I turn on my computer, the keyboard only stays on for about 5-20 minutes and wont turn back on if I unplug an replug the USB, it will sometimes turn back on if I restart my PC a couple times and I cant even return it because I don't still have the original packaging since I bought it in the middle of a move. It was not worth the money and is unusable. Next time I'll just order from a more reliable brand.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this.
customer_reviews.text: When the keyboard arrived I was impressed with how clean and sharp the construction is. White keyboards are not widely available and this one had many good reviews. I do understand that this is a blue switch keyboard and that will be noise, but the little metal echoing that it makes is super annoying. I'm leaning to return it based on that as I can get past the additional echo noise... It gets one star for the built and construction and another one for the backlit controls without software. It loses 2 because of the echo, and 1 because their website/access to documentation and instructions is confusing.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandre Costa

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Be warned the keys are pretttty loud. (at least if you're not used to a mechanical keyboard). Works perfectly. The only issue I've had is that when I turn the light off it will come back on after about 10 minutes. It also won't turn on at the level brightness I set it to. I just disable the keyboard when i turn off my computer so its not a big deal tho. Another complaint is that The keyboard itself did not come with the commands for changing the light. I actually found them amongst the reviews. [ Fn then scrlk turns the light off and on// Fn then - or + will turn the brightness up and down]
customer_reviews.author: ingrid wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard for what it is
customer_reviews.text: For less than 40 bucks I was a bit skeptical about buying a mechanical keyboard but I was wrong. The build quality is top notch the keyboard has a good weight to it. The buttons are very nice and clicky. The led light isn't too bright or too dim. I also have a corsair keyboard I bought for over 200 dollars and this keyboard doesn't feel lesser quality to it. Edit* after less than a month of use the LED started dying out. Don't ignore the comments because I saw a lot of complaints about the issue and sure enough happened to me.
customer_reviews.author: GReddy

customer_reviews.title: Not loud at all!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to game on in my parents basement. At first the this keyboard was definingly loud. But don’t worry the more I used it it got quiter! But for some reason my mother came up from behind shaking me. She ran back upstairs (probably to get me some more tendies) The keyboard isn’t making anymore sound either!!! Mommy came back down to my gamer haven a few days later and took me to an audiologists? Turns out I’m completely deaf. Thanks Eagletech!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Lowrance

customer_reviews.title: Love blue light and the aluminum body
customer_reviews.text: KB is well built w/ aluminum body, works great, and sound fantastic. I like to code at night in my office with very minimal light or only light from my monitors, so the blue dimmable keyboard light is a great feature. Give me just enough KB light without causing any distraction. Sometime the clicking sound can be a distraction, which can be easily solve by putting on noise cancellation headphone. I would not recommend this keyboard if you have to share work space with other people, because they may not want to hear the constant clicking from your keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: JS 91362

customer_reviews.title: Nice with Caveats
customer_reviews.text: I really like the feel of this keyboard. It is like the older mechanical keyboards. That said, I've noted two things. (1) No volume control keys on top of the keyboard. These days having to fumble around for the Fn key combo is really out of date; and (2) the keys are somewhat closer together than other wireless keyboards. Excluding those two things, it is well built and not horribly loud. I may keep it.
customer_reviews.author: Customer1

customer_reviews.title: Entry level mechanical keyboard owner- VERY happy!
customer_reviews.text: I have been working on a Logitech and HP laptop for years, but I do a lot of heavy typing and work 7 days a week. My keyboards get a lot of use, and my fingers get fairly strained. I was looking to make a change and everything advised that mechanical keyboards were the way to go. As an entry level owner of a mechanical keyboard, I didn't want to spend a lot because I wasn't sure if I would like it or how it would work for me..but I am sold! Very solid construction, the light is exactly what I needed, and my typing is much more relaxed now. I'm highly satisfied for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: rmjaxon

customer_reviews.title: Like it a lot
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid mechanical keyboard. It's easy to type with, has no problem responding to the right pressure, and I like the look of it. I was very pleased to see a keyboard with blue LED and a 10-key for this price and I'm not disappointed. My one minor issue is that there is no easy to reach volume control. You have to hold down the function key on the right side of the keyboard and use the F2-F4 buttons to adjust volume. Would prefer something I can operate one-handed while gaming (either push button on top or the use of F9-F11).
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Davis

customer_reviews.title: The perfect keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed with the beauty and quality of the EagleTec ET-KG011 keyboard. The brushed metal frame and blue-lit, easy to see letters are great-looking. The biggest benefit to me is the biofeedback I get when I use it. My keying has become more accurate, which means I'm faster and more confident at the computer. Because of the quality materials and construction, I expect this keyboard to last a really long time. This was a wise purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn V.

customer_reviews.title: Almost 2 years nonstop use before fail; came back for another one !
customer_reviews.text: Updating my prior review of this awesome keyboard (can't find post to edit, so here is new one!). I bought one two years ago,and used 10 hours a day for copy editing, marketing, writing, social media, photoshop and video editing, etc. -- tons of daily copy/paste ... finally killed the space bar after almost 2 years of flawless use. Loved it so much I just came back to buy another one. Great keyboard (I have silver with blue backlight, using with Windows 10 running on Mac hardware).
customer_reviews.author: Christopher L. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Keyed In
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to finish off my NZXT build. Love the Tron look and the description says everything you need to know and lives up to advertising. The only down side is that the keys are loud, but hey, style over substance and it is a truly minor thing. Great middle of the road keyboard for my E-Soprts set up.
customer_reviews.author: Hockeymom20

customer_reviews.title: Fun keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought the white one, and I love this wild keyboard! It's super clickedy -- which I love. I know that can be annoying for some. But nothing's as accurate or responsive as a mechanical keyboard, so it comes with the territory. It's really easy to see the keys -- I'm not the best typer, so I need to occasionally look down. Love, love, love the blue. This one's a keeper for my home office. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than my razer
customer_reviews.text: Was honestly just looking for a decent Keyboard to match my gaming PCs color scheme I found this online while looking for a reasonable priced mech. keyboard. I highly recommend watching some of the youtube reviews about this. This thing is a tank. Strong solid i've had it for awhile now and it's doing just dandy. My kid even pulls all over the keys and slobbers on it and it's still going strong. Highly recommend over the Razer and Logitech keyboards that I had before.
customer_reviews.author: randy hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Dead keys after a year
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - design is aesthetically nice - material and build quality looks and feels nice - action is nice for the price - backlighting is nice Cons: - after 3 months, backlight under the N key died. replacement would've cost me shipping both ways, according to customer service - after a little over a year of moderate personal use, the O and W keys have begun triggering only about half of the time
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Rubinetti

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous and effective wired keyboard
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful keyboard that checks almost every box I had in mind. I wanted... 1. Mechanical blue switches 2. Backlit 3. Brushed aluminum 4. Wireless And this checks 3/4 of those. It's not wireless, however, which means it's a bit cumbersome to move out of the way when bringing my Surface Studio into drafting mode. If they would come out with a wireless, version I'd buy it immediately. As it is, this is a great keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: True old school feel and sound
customer_reviews.text: If you are old enough to recall mainframe IBM and Sperry keyboards, you will love the touch and noise that this keyboard generates. It is totally classic and adds the convenience of being a nightlight. The downside is the light is blue and not exactly comforting to your eyes in a dark room. I love the sturdy, noisy banging as well as the old key bounce.
customer_reviews.author: ross80477

customer_reviews.title: Awesome keyboard for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a gamer but was looking for a really good backlit keyboard. This keyboard exceeded my expectations. It's light and bright housed in a unique aluminum frame. Very different from any keyboard I've seen in the past. Only small negative is it didn't come with any instructions for on/off. I had to go searching on You Tube. Pressing FN+ScrLk turns the board on and off. And noise conscious folks might not like the clicking keys..I thought they were positive and kinda cool.
customer_reviews.author: NC Big Mike

customer_reviews.title: Certain Keys dont work
customer_reviews.text: I've officially had this keyboard for a few months now, and I primarily use it for gaming and schoolwork. I wanted to like it because it matches my setup and is super cute, but after a few months the keys started dying one by one. I can't use the s, o, tab, and now q key is failing. This is very frustrating because I've never had this issue with a keyboard before, and plugging in my old keyboard, their keys work just fine. Be weary before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Visual problems - Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is amazing. I do much online in the evening or late into the night. No need for any other lights in the room with this keyboard. Also good for anyone with visual problems during the day. Meets all of my needs. Will never use any other type keyboard. Fabulous invention. Just hope the bulbs last but the lights do go off when the computer is closed down.
customer_reviews.author: Brownie45

customer_reviews.title: Best $50 I've spent in a long time.
customer_reviews.text: Had this keyboard for a couple of weeks and absolutely love it. This is my first "mechanical" keyboard and I am just floored at how awesome it is compared to the prices of the more popular ones. It pairs nicely with the combaterwing mouse I already had. Very pleased with it. Some reviews state it is stiffer than another type of keyboard and they are probably right (as I have no point of reference) but I think that those should be considered with "a grain of salt" and in context. The keys are not hard to press, and typing feels fluid and satisfying. If you're on the fence, let me help tip you; Get it!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: It's a pretty solid keyboard for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty solid keyboard for the price. You will notice any dirt or crumbs in your keyboard quite easily because of the color scheme. I'm not sure if I would recommend this keyboard but if you are looking for a white mechanical keyboard in this lower price range then I definitely recommend it. It will get the job done and it feels solid. The keys almost feel like mx cherry blues, super loud and clacky just like I like. Not all people will like that though.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Easy to see
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 5 stars for gaming because I didn't have the option to skip the category. In all honesty, I don't know. I bought this for my boyfriend because I get migraines and have to keep the room dark when I get one. He used to complain that he couldn't see his keyboard so I got him this. It's perfect. It's not a super backglow so the letters and numbers are clear. It works for us.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking primarily for a backlit keyboard and this one seemed to fit the bill. Not really using it for gaming but I am very, very impressed with the sturdiness and how well it is made. I had purchased a previous mac compatible keyboard only to have the caps lock light fail after only a couple of weeks. Since I do quite a bit of typing that was a major problem. This keyboard is built to last, very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Riley Rocks

customer_reviews.title: I love this keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I will never buy a Logitech again! So many years suffering through their design. This keyboard feels so good on the fingers. No worries about the keys breaking if you type fast or hard at times. The blue glow is nicely bright, but can be dimmed or even pulse. One key stroke to shut it off for darker atmosphere. Lots of built in hot keys. Well made!
customer_reviews.author: Charles R

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Keyboard !!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my razor keyboard, Honestly I am DONE with Razor, the updates and bugs. I bought this one, let me tell you this thing is SOLID ! The only thing i did not care for was the mechanical clacking this thing makes but overall It is awesome !! I have win 10 so no downloads or extra software. The lighting is just right, a heavy keyboard sits in place, Love the metal design !
customer_reviews.author: xcopper

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for the price
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard came with blue equivalent switches. I have found they keys to be very nice and crisp. I have found no wobbly keys or anomalies. This keyboard seems to be well made and I really like the blue lights, though I wish there were more options for lighting patterns. This is my second keyboard from Eagletec and I have been very happy with both. If they hold up well over the years, I will be very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a good keyboard for the price. It was my first test run of a mechanical keyboard, and I very much enjoyed it over the stock dell membrane keyboard I was using at work. However, I used this for about 6 months before upgrading to a Corsair k95. In the long run it might be better to save your money and buy a higher quality keyboard to start.
customer_reviews.author: CORY Mauer

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I game 6-8 hours at a time and I'm always delighted to use this keyboard. It almost makes me want to write I book! That's how good this keyboard is. It's like playing a great piano it's a pleasure to type on this well designed instrument! I got the blue and love the color etc. It's fantastic. Get your hands on this for any price.
customer_reviews.author: Bert Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: When you want people to know you are typing
customer_reviews.text: It's cool. I ordered it for my office. I used it for a grand total of two sentences before everyone in the office told me to shut up and go back to my lame dell keyboard. This is an extremely, extremely loud keyboard. It's super. Super. Loud. O-rings won't help either, the click is from the switch itself. If it weren't so loud, I'd probably give it another star.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Smith

customer_reviews.title: Click Clack
customer_reviews.text: First mechanical keyboard, it's great. Nice feel/bounce to the keys and loud. Something I should have seen earlier is that the Fn key is to the right of the space bar instead of the left. ISSUE: keyboard lights up after shutting down laptop, tried turning it off before shut down. Don't understand the need to have it lit up when it's not in use and the computer is off. How to disable the lights when the computer is off?
customer_reviews.author: TKO

customer_reviews.title: Very well built, returned because was to clicky.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wanted a nonmembrane keyboard that clicked. I loved the build quality and the looks of this keyboard, but alas, keyboards come down to the tactile feel and the noise level, so this one went back. Would definitely recommend if like clicky keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Bjmarks

customer_reviews.title: Need to include a manual with the keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love the keyboard! but lack of info on it was a pain. They don't tell you how to turn things off or on you have to look up the manual on line to figure this out. If you need help on how to things on or off on this keyboard let me know took a few hours of finding a PDF that outlined the keyboard shortcuts. Keyboard great manuals a -1
customer_reviews.author: SCOTT ISENBERG

customer_reviews.title: works great, like the blue light
customer_reviews.text: Works great...sound is a little annoying would be nice if it was a little quieter but not a deal breaker. Best part is the blue lighting. Great for darker lighted rooms or working at night and that's why I bought it. The noise clicking of keys is not exactly a benefit in my book unless that makes it more reliable than it is acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: K. Swain

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my wife for Valentine's day. ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife for Valentine's day. She had stolen an extra keyboard from my office for her computer. When I tried to explain the benefits of a mechanical keyboard to her, she asks if the reason the keys on her keyboard stick is because they are mechanical. I had to explain that "no, the keys on your keyboard stick because a dog peed on the keyboard and I ran it under a faucet and never expected to use it again." It goes without saying that this keyboard is a HUGE step up from a non-mechanical keyboard with sticky keys from dried dog pee. She loves this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: CSL

customer_reviews.title: No problems so far
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had this keyboard for very long, but in the time I have had it, no problems have shown up. There are no issues with ghosting (thei nability to press some multiple keys at the same time), no contact issues, and it understands my inputs just like it should. I love the "kchchkckckhchcchkckhckchk" noise it makes when I type, though the people around you may not appreciate that LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Crimson Cuttlefish

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: + responsive, clicky keys + rather long USB cable + keys easily removeable for cleaning + nice LED effects (on/off via FN + ScrLk keys) + unbeatable price vs. high-end name brand comparable product - you will get zapped a lot if static is an issue in your area of use
customer_reviews.author: ChrisC

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good keyboard for the price. I returned it as it didn’t fit my needs for my Mac at work but it was still a decent product. One of the downsides I saw was a loud, metallic spring sound occasionally as you typed, I assume this is due to the cheaper quality you are paying less for.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: An amazing keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: As of making this review I got the product and I'm actually writing this review with the keyboard. Right off the bat, I LOVE THIS KEYBOARD. I may be hyped because this is my first mechanical keyboard but MAN does it feel good. The aluminium brush and white keys also look extremely modern and fits in well with a white PC setup. NOTE that the back light is a darker shade of blue than seen on the pictures. If I encounter any problem I'll be sure to update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Suz Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: BAD QC DONT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard was really good while it worked and suddenly the right arrow key would sometimes work and then stopped working about a month into purchase and I use that key sometimes. The customer support is awful and beware everyone from buying this same keyboard . Only looks and feels nice but if the switches dont work then there is no use in having this keyboard. Just buy another brand that includes spare switches around same price. This keyboard is just a waste off money.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Feel like a damn Jedi at home.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Feels like true blue keys for mech heads. It is however, loud. I knew this and chose this purposefully because I like the sounds when I type. This is very much a keyboard I enjoy at home, not one for the office unless you add dampeners. Get a brown key for that. It lights up in a very badass way, and the metal is sturdy and sleek. All in all a 5/5 personally.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: the metalic body feels nice and heavy
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is dank. Just as clicky as you want it to be, sick-butt blue neon color, the metalic body feels nice and heavy. Buy it if you like what you see. I have one complaint: the F keys have an alternate function shown on them, for skipping video and changing volume, and for the life of me i dont know how to activate the alternate function. It is most likely operator error though. The keyboard is really fun to write/game with, I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clicky goodness
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is a dream come true. I loathe soft, short keys with no response (like on my laptop). This keyboard gives me all the feels! It's responsive and clicky, just what I wanted! The blue backlight seemed kinda flashy to me, but now that I have it, I love the light! You do have the option to turn the light off if you don't like it. 100% would repurchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am in LOVE with my keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I am in LOVE with my keyboard! The metallic finish is just beautiful and smooth. The illuminating light is so pretty! Yes, the keys are rather noisy, but that is why I bought a mechanical keyboard -- to hear myself type -- and for the raised keys that feel more natural. Don't like the clacking sound? I'd recommend getting some of those key silencer thingys lol. Wouldn't recommend if clacking noisy sound of a keyboard annoys you. If it doesn't bother you, then get it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Type faster with less effort but the keys are so loud
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, compact, and great backlighting. I am in a home office typing all day and I want things as ergonomic and efficient as possible. The mechanical keys are very responsive but SO loud. If you are on the phone, you can't keep working without the other party hearing your typing or if you work near others, it may be disturbing. I wanted a wireless keyboard with backlit keys but they were too large for the space I use.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. mOe Anderson , D.D.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard for the price! I just bought a second monitor, so I wanted to be able to use a keyboard other than the one on my laptop for ease of use. This is fantastic! The blue illumination is very pretty. I love the clicking sounds it makes whenever I type,. And the feedback is great and I experience no issues using it. For the price, it is a great keyboard of high quality.
customer_reviews.author: CHRIS

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard!! If you're not used to a mechanical keyboard, they're a little bit louder when typing and the board itself produces a sort of hollow sound. I imagine when gaming you wouldn't notice it though. I just bought it because I love way it looks. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Metallic sound for key strokes - sounds cheap
customer_reviews.text: I like the mechanical key strokes but there is a slight metallic sound with every button press. It almost sounds like a ringing sound - maybe the springs. It makes the keyboard sound cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Caloucon

customer_reviews.title: the EagleTec KG011 keyboard is amazing. The feel of the keys is almost exact ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, the EagleTec KG011 keyboard is amazing. The feel of the keys is almost exact to that of Cherry MX blues, which of course this keyboard does not have. Overall, the clickiness is a bit loud too, I am personally a fan of it, but I can see why some people may not be. Overall, one of the best keyboards for under $100 that is mechanical. I have had no complaints so far, a great keyboard for the price, looks very professional when paired with matching mice, monitors, and mousepads.
customer_reviews.author: Turner

customer_reviews.title: Feels great and looks neat!
customer_reviews.text: It does the job for me as someone who wants to retrain myself with a mechanical keyboard for practicing typing. It feels good and I don't get cramps if I do type practicing for a while on it. A little loud, but that's par for the course for mechanical keyboard for the most part. Love this one! :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Mechanical Keyboard at a reasonable price point.
customer_reviews.text: Great mechanical keyboard at a great price. I own a couple of DasKeyboard keyboards and love 'em, but they are NOT cheap at all, costing probably 3 times what this keyboard cost. The EagleTec KG011 is great - it works well, and has a pleasing tactile functionality. Not sure yet how I feel about the lights.... it would be nice if one could turn up/down the lighting intensity (if you can, it's certainly not obvious), but the backlit effect is quite pleasing. Overall, it's a great keyboard at a really reasonable price point.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Laws

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard is as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Love this and the pretty blue light color. Love the touch of the keys, and the typing sound. It is not intrusive at all. Also the light shuts off when you put your PC to sleep. Comes on immediately at start. Just what I wanted. The dimmable light is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Monica E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Looks a lot like a keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Works like one too, very shiny, loud. Was going to put this on a grad-students desk to test it on younger, more tolerant and less essential personnel but the dean saw it and demanded one so now it's on the dean's desk. :O
customer_reviews.author: Tobias L Merriman

customer_reviews.title: Makes typing incredibly fun.
customer_reviews.text: I'm leaving this comment because IT IS SO MUCH FUN TO TYPE with this keyboard! At first I thought that the scroll lock and the number lock keys were not registering. However, I realized that it doesnt work on a MAC, but on a windows PC, it works perfectly! Before figuring this out, I had thought that my keyboard was broken and ordered the black one for a steal during cyber monday. I bought the second keyboard with the intention of returning this but my mom actually asked to have one because she liked it so much. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Looses keyboard layout when modifier keys like Ctrl, Alt, Shift are pressed
customer_reviews.text: I use Linux (Solus Fortitude distro) and I never had a problem with any keyboard except this one. To make matters very unique and worse for me I use Dvorak keyboard layout along some shortcuts to increase productivity e.g. Shift+Alt+S will open or bring to focus Sublime Text application etc. When I press this key combo I get Shift+Alt+: that is ":" colon character instead of 's'. The reason this happens is character 's' is Dvorak layout maps to ':' colon character in Qwerty layout. Worthy of mention is the fact that without modifier key presses the Dvorak keyboard layout works just fine. I have to return an otherwise great product since my productivity has gone down.
customer_reviews.author: daya

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Feel: Mechnical clikity-clak-clikity-clak feels great. Loud as it should be but appealing to the feel. Response: Good response Operations: The bluish tint is cool but when my iMAC wakes it is hard to control the dimming functions. At times, the keyboard does not properly respond to dim up/down or sound up/down using the Windows function or special keys. Overall: Good buy and does the job. Keys are responsive, priced appropriately and LED dimming option is available and can be turned OFF if needed
customer_reviews.author: S9673

customer_reviews.title: Affordable but good quality, really satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: I've never owned a mechanical keyboard before this one but I think its really fantastic for the price. The brushed steel back plate with the white keys & adjustable blue LED is really classy, much better looking than a lot of the more expensive "gamer" keyboard models that just look tacky. It looks better in person than it did on the pictures in my opinion. My only complaint is that there is one tiny nick on the brushed steel on the bottom right corner of the keyboard, going off of other reviews this is a common occurrence. Overall I'd definitely recommend this to somebody else looking for a really solid but affordable mechanical keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: AnonReview

customer_reviews.title: Great for 2 years, but now it's non-functional
customer_reviews.text: It took me about 3 months of frustration to realize that all the issues I was having on my desktop were due to the keys sticking and pressing themselves - imagine a 2 year old just clacking away randomly on your keyboard as you try to do anything at all on the computer. Finally realized it was the keys, tried to clean every key, still broken and sticking. Had to dump it. Might get another because it last 2 years which isn't bad for the price. Liked it up until it went insane.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: SOLID keyboard
customer_reviews.text: As solid as it is, there is ONE "flaw" - those of you who used computers in the 1980's know what I am talking about. The click-clack of the keys as they are being used. You will get accustomed to it, eventually - however, I am the one that loves a quiet environment. The plus - keys are tested to withstand 15 MILLION strokes. Would I trade this for an EQUAL keyboard that is quiet? In a heart beat... However, not finding too many that equal the rigor and solid construction of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett OBrien

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Love the keyboard. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality. I went back and forth between a used RGB white and the white with the blue backlighting. I went with the blue and I don't regret it; it is so different and most of my electronics are black so this stands out. This also works with my PS4 when I play Fortnite. Love the sound, comfort, and look.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: this is my second mechanical keyboard ... although the WASD keys may give off a gaming vibe .. it is great for typing (im finding myself more accurate and faster) >> my first mechanical keyboard had brown switches and no keypad .. i enjoy the feedback of the blue switches on this keyboard more (although its more clicky so if you work in an office environment the noise maybe an issue) and the keypad is great for creative work and computational coding >> it looks great and the back lighting is awesome
customer_reviews.author: Hesham

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Keyboard, Probably Too Loud for Office...
customer_reviews.text: Not great for office use... My HR department sat me down within a month of using it because it was "bothersome to my coworkers." It has a pretty audible clicking sound, and even though I asked those in my immediate workgroup if it bothered them, I actually had someone halfway across the office complain it was annoying him. That being said, I love this keyboard and would recommend it to anyone. Very comfortable, good feedback, pretty blue backlighting, and stylish brushed metal board.
customer_reviews.author: Squatz McAllister

customer_reviews.title: bad investment
customer_reviews.text: I've only been using this keyboard for a few weeks now and the "N" key is malfunctioning. I have to hit it several times to get a result and half the time that it DOES work, I end up with multiple "N's." It's making typing on my computer extremely irritating. Other than that I LOVE how it looks. The lit keys are great, solid construction (other than the misbehaving key.)
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Renae Mckinney

customer_reviews.title: Good overall but loud and echo-y
customer_reviews.text: No regrets for the money. The keys feel great. They have a very satisfying click. I like typing on this more than my other keyboard which has Cherry MX Browns. The LEDs look great. My only complaint is the thing echoes when you type, like a guitar, due to the thin aluminum casing. It would actually be better if it was plastic. It only annoys me a little bit because it's in my home office, but I wouldn't recommend using this in a busy office setting.
customer_reviews.author: JackD

customer_reviews.title: Had to try out the new keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It's so loud! Exactly what I was looking for in a mechanical keyboard. It has been out of the box for only a few minutes, but so far it is working wonderfully. The metal looks sturdy and the LED colors underneath the keys are brilliant. Very much recommend at the price point.
customer_reviews.author: 16th

customer_reviews.title: It's a very nice keyboard BUT
customer_reviews.text: sometimes, when I go to type it types very slow, like I can type the words to a sentence or two but it takes a minute to translate it to the screen. It doesn't happen often but when It does it's a pain in the butt. Otherwise, a great, great keyboard, I'm happy
customer_reviews.author: Karen Martin

customer_reviews.title: This is my first mechanical keyboard. Feels rock solid ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first mechanical keyboard. Feels rock solid, but with that, it also is much heavier than any previous keyboards I've owned. The grips on underneath it work too well! It doesn't slide at all which I guess it's working as intended, but I move my keyboard from my desk to my lap frequently which having the keyboard not slide makes a bit tougher.
customer_reviews.author: Jake from State Farm

customer_reviews.title: Solid clean construction
customer_reviews.text: The material feels high quality with the key mechanism being very clean and solid. The keys don't move when you're resting your hands on them. It clicks a bit loud but that's with any mechanical keyboard. The backlight is nice but only blue and there are a few settings for it. They have the next tier up keyboard for rbg led and many more options for settings for the led. Over all I think it's a quality product for a pretty good price.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Randall Preston

customer_reviews.title: NOISY !!!!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is well made, performs well, and looks good. However, it is without question the noisiest board I have ever used. This is a problem for me because I am a medical transcriptionist and it is so noisy I am sometimes unable to hear the doctor. It has very "clicky" outemu blue switches.
customer_reviews.author: Anne A.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: It seems ridiculous to rhapsodize over a keyboard, but this product justifies it. It's stylish with its blue back-light and aluminum trim, very well-made, and the key travel, resistance and feedback are all perfect. But it's the click that's got me - that sound from 25 years ago that evokes my first IBM PC and that seems to make every word I type seem so important. It's a wonderful piece of nostalgia, but also a far more pleasant, comfortable and satisfying experience to use than any other keyboard I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Max Davies

customer_reviews.title: Keys make the keyboard ring with each click
customer_reviews.text: Well they are definitely the blue switches... however be aware that the body is mostly hollow and that the actual click of thbait key resonates the hollow body and then metal finish, if you want to torture your office mates get this keyboard. It gets the star for the light, perfect brightness and able to turn off during the day and still able to read the keys
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Clackity and Visually Appealing
customer_reviews.text: This mechanical keyboard is loud, but it feels nice when you are typing. It reminds me of a retro PC keyboard from the 80's. It clacks a lot, but it's not annoying. The blue back-light and key lights are beautiful. It would be awesome if this was wireless, but I'm not mad that it's a USB connection.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Enke Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Very Clickity!
customer_reviews.text: As others have noted, not quiet at all but that is not why I purchased. I had a backlighted Logitech that didn't make it a year before keys started sticking & not typing symbol. So I decided to try this mechanical keyboard, it is loud but not unpleasant so if keys don't stick, color me HAPPY!
customer_reviews.author: James Alan Conrad

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a writer by trade and this is a great set up. And I have to confess I mostly bought it for the blue backlight. Really love the bounce of the keys and responsiveness. I have another mechanical keyboard that was almost 3x's as much and this is right there with quality. I just wanted the extended keyboard with keypad. I missed it a lot. I am an apple user, so it's a little tricky to get used to the slightly different keys, but it was a very quick transition.
customer_reviews.author: lateniteTLC

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful product
customer_reviews.text: Great Keyboard,my first Mechanical and it is a beauty! Love the removable keys and you can make it “breathe” the blue LED! Hold FN and press home and it will change functionality! I wish I would have bought the RGB one tho is my only regret cause this thing is beautifully designed
customer_reviews.author: Joseph G Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Doesn' work ou of he box
customer_reviews.text: As you can see, my " " buom doesn' work. You can guess which key I'm alking abou. I's quie random, I know. Bu having his key no work is very annoying. I was brand new as well. ha's he mos disappoining hing.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Fields

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good click clack and it's very bright. Exactly like the picture. Edit: I wrote this review a veeeeeery long time ago. Over a year. And my keyboard is finally dying. It looks like the left arrow key is stuck but I can't find anything stuck under it and I can't get the key off so I think it's time for a new one. I love this keyboard a lot. It's well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Ling

customer_reviews.title: SO LOUD
customer_reviews.text: These keys are so loud that my mother-in-law (with whom we live) may or may not be planning to injure my body. But it is SO satisfying to type on. I'm pretty sure it makes me type faster, too! And the keys light up! How awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Chris S

customer_reviews.title: Love the click clacks
customer_reviews.text: I like this keyboard so far, no problems and its easy to clean since its very open. Love the click keys, the first time I used it a family member said why you typing so aggressively? but that was the only time. Also love the blue lighting!! now I can play in the dark ftw! I didn't rate the sleep mode because I'm not sure about that.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Auguste

customer_reviews.title: I like it, don't love it.
customer_reviews.text: The EagleTec KG011 could use individual buttons for things like volume up/down/mute and sleep/wake up. It's also noisy like an old time typewriter. This bothers my wife when she's in the same room. On the positive, it looks great and functions as it should.
customer_reviews.author: John Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'll be honest I mostly just wanted a really loud keyboard because it feels awesome to type and be noisy at my desk. However, i'm getting rave reviews from the IT engineers I work with on how great it is so - that's gotta be worth something right? And no one can believe I got this for that price.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: I am so happy and satisfied with my decision
customer_reviews.text: this item is exactly what I was looking for. I am so happy and satisfied with my decision! This keyboard noise level is high as old vintage keyboard, which I love, and even though you only see the blue LED light, It is still pretty and you can adjust the light level. The silver background matches with white color and I'm in love with this keyboard :)
customer_reviews.author: Jam

customer_reviews.title: TOO LOUD!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I have to close the office door to keep from disturbing anyone else with the loud clicking key sound. I just want to use my keyboard without hearing it too much. I love the look of this and the back lit blue but I guess I'll go back to my old quiet keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: DIY Dave

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mechanical for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as I wanted a mechanical keyboard for work (data entry) yet easy to clean and inexpensive in case someone took off with it. This one is perfect, so easy to clean, and with silencers (and without telling my coworkers it's mechanical so they notice they know there is a difference) no one complains :) I also keep the blue light off during work as it just draws coworkers to you like moths to a light.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Extremely loud
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard looks nice and appears to be good quality. Attached and used it for one minute then decided to return it because it is obnoxiously loud. The clicking of the keys can be heard far away and very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Eyestyle

customer_reviews.title: Sweet!
customer_reviews.text: A really great bargain. I was really surprised at the build quality and the number of features. This seems as well-built and feature-packed as my Cooler Master TK Storm, at 1/3 the price. There seem to be more backlight adjustment levels, too. Also, the fact that you can clean under & around the keys is a huge bonus. I highly recommend this keayboard to anyone that likes an audible clicky mechanical keyboard!!
customer_reviews.author: John C Thorpe

customer_reviews.title: Very Loud!
customer_reviews.text: I tried it out very briefly and immediately boxed it back up to return. This keyboard is so incredibly loud there is no way I could stand it. Nice looking is about all the good I can say about it. Not ergonomic- just has the feet they all do
customer_reviews.author: Will Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard I've ever used for work deff worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: I love this I use it for work at my desk and I get compliments on this at least two or three times a day at is amazing I'm best keyboard I have ever used and I would definitely recommend this for anyone either for gaming or just to use at your desk for work!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Genessa W.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: it is a VERY loud keyboard if that's what you're looking for. it is beautiful. absolutely love it. its so pleasing to feel and hear the keys clacking away. its nice that they also made it so that the brightness of the backlight can be changed. would recommend for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Came with a sticky key
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard was mostly perfect when it arrived. It feels great to type on and I really like the overall design and aesthetic of it. The one glaring issue that happened in my case is that the apostrophe/quotation mark key is incredibly sticky. Pushing down on it lightly makes it stay down and using more force causes a delay in it coming back up which is also not ideal. YMMV of course, but just know that you are risking a potentially defective product.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Ricardo dos Remedios

customer_reviews.title: Good product AWFUL customer service and warranty. Didn’t honor it.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this keyboard for 4 years now. It has been a great keyboard! Had a issue with it after 2 years and tried to use my “warranty” that I even paid for the protection plan and they didn’t honor it so that sucked. But it has been a decent keyboard. The key clicks are louder then most mechanical keyboards but I actually like it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a cool keyboard well look no farther
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing, I love the sound of the click keyboard which isn't that bad and the back light feature is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Escobar

customer_reviews.title: There's no ghosting which is great and after using this I can't go back to ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a cheap mechanical keyboard. It clicks and clacks, about the same noise level as older keyboards. Sometimes the LED's on certain keys dim a bit. I play games with it and have no problem. There's no ghosting which is great and after using this I can't go back to normal keyboards. Price could be lower, the design is actually used by a different company for about 10-15 bucks cheaper. Overall, good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Canon and Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: I'm a transcriptionist and i love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this keyboard this morning. After one days' work, I have to say I AM IN LOVE WITH IT. The quality is excellent and seems highly durable. The accuracy and responsiveness are just what I need being a transcriptionist with a fast typing speed. The keyboard is pretty LOUD but I don't mind it. I actually enjoy the clickety-clack :) HIGHLY RECOMMEND. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: whitney hardman

customer_reviews.title: and none are as bad as this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The keys stick, and it just feels cheap. I own and operate many mechanical keyboards, some cheaper than this some > $200-300, and none are as bad as this keyboard. From forcing you hands to rest in the most un-ergonomic and uncomfortable position known to man, to only recognizing 7/10 keystrokes, to simply feeling like a $10 keyboard from Walmart this keyboard is a light up piece of junk. It looks cool, but if you're willing to spend $50 on keyboard just do yourself a major favor and skip this intermediate step. Get a $100-$150 keyboard such as a Razer or Ducky, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: bobby

customer_reviews.title: Very pretty but loud
customer_reviews.text: It looks great b/c of the white keys and the light-up feature w/ the blue lights. I like the way the keys feel b/c I like the clicky types of keys - the only thing is that I wish the keys were not against the metal plate, b/c the typing is very loud. If the keys laid on a plastic surface, the clicking level would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Eagletec KG011 Mechanical Keyboard Wired Ergonomic Clicky Blue Switch Equivalent for Office PC Home or Business (White Keyboard RGB LED Backlit)
feature_bullets: Gaming Keyboard for Home or Office the EagleTec KG010 with 104 Keys and Dust Proof Blue Switches (Cherry MX Blue equivalent) Clicky, medium resistance, audible loud click sound, crisp precise tactile feedback, good for typing and gaming

RGB LED backlit mechanical gaming keyboard 5 different lighting modes, 5 backlight brightness levels, breathing speed, user programmable RGB backlighting the precision engineered keycaps offering crystal clear lettering that doesn't scratch off

Aircraft Grade Aluminum Abs Construction the PC Gaming Keyboard is constructed of Aircraft-Grade Aluminum and ABS with plate-mounted mechanical keys and switches that stand up to tough gaming conditions

Ergonomic Keyboard, Anti Ghosting All 104 mechanical keys are conflict free (n-Key Rollover), Non-Slip Ergonomic Spill Proof Design. Full Size with Numeric Keypad, Multimedia Keys, WASD Arrows Key Exchange, Lockable Windows key

USB Mechanical Keyboard with lights Compatibility Windows 10, 8, 7, Vista, XP, Limited Mac OS keyboard support. Works well with all major Computers Brands and Gaming PCs MSI, Dell, Corsair, Alienware, Razer, PS4, Xbox One, Asus and others

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars3,144 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
